N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 86-4.22 - Recoveries of expense

State Regulations

Operating costs shall be reduced by the cost of services and activities which are not properly chargeable to patient care. In the event that the commissioner determines that it is not practical to establish the costs of such services and activities, the income derived from them may be substituted for their costs. The activities and services covered by this provision include, but are not limited to: (a) drugs and supplies sold to other than facility patients; (b) telephone and telegraph services for which a charge is made; (c) discount on purchases; (d) sale of scrap; (e) employee cafeterias; (f) vending machines; (g) operation of parking facilities for community convenience; (h) lease of office and other space to concessionaires; and
(i) sale of silver from X-ray films. Notes
